Related to hypoxaemia

* Polycythemia (inconstant, other mechanisms including inflammation associated with chronic pathologies can counteract this phenomenon).
* Group 3 pulmonary hypertension
** Related to chronic hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction.
** Can be looked for on cardiac ultrasound (assessment of systolic pulmonary artery pressure) and clinical examination (signs of right ventricular failure grouped under the term chronic pulmonary heart disease in this context).
**
** Related to hypercapnia
*** Asthenia, somnolence, impairment of higher functions

question.title: What is a consequence of chronic kidney disease (CKD)?

option_a.title: Acute respiratory failure
option_a.description: A complication of CKD that can lead to respiratory failure

option_b.title: Pulmonary hypertension
option_b.description: A common consequence of CKD, but also related to chronic hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction

option_c.title: Fluid and sodium retention
option_c.description: A consequence of CKD, but not directly related to the options listed

option_d.title: Hypercapnia
option_d.description: A condition characterized by elevated CO2 levels, but not a direct consequence of CKD
